sense.name: an enterprise engaged in creating promotional material
sense.commentary: ADVERTISING[+organization][+enterprise][+business][+promotional] Note: refers to the enterprise or business that produces ads, not the content of the ads (Sense 2)
sense.examples: Those two men are the top CEOs in advertising. The soft drink maker has hired a new advertising agency. Take these photographs down to advertising on the 2nd floor.

sense.name: promotional media or content, e.g., brochure, video, pop-up window, billboard
sense.commentary: ADVERTISING[+artifact][+medium][+with_content][+promotional] Note: refers to the information content in a medium, not the event of disseminating it (Sense 3)
sense.examples: I just skip through the advertising in this magazine. Mary uses a program on her browser to block the pop-up windows of advertising. The advertising showing a half-clad girl in jeans on a billboard was controversial.

sense.name: the event or act of publicizing something
sense.commentary: ADVERTISING[+event][+communication][+publicizing][+of_information] Note: refers to an agent engaged in an activity of publicizing something. Note: 'X's {+agent} advertising of Y {+thing_publicized}' means 'X advertised Y'
sense.examples: The advertising of this conference was not well organized. John's advertising of his accomplishments at the meeting did not impress anyone.
